newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian fringe benefit tax here to stay - PM.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian fringe benefit tax here to stay - PM.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard said Tuesday the Federal government could not afford to abolish the fringe benefit tax.

"In the election we did not hold out the prospect of abolishing the fringe benefits tax because frankly we can't afford to do so ... it is a little question of trying to balance the books," he told a Liberal Party function in Adelaide.
Howard said the tax was unreasonably complicated and the government was looking at ways to reduce the regulatory burden.
"But we don't have the wherewithal at present, and I cannot immediately see where it is going to come from, to abolish it."
The fringe benefit tax, which taxes corporate perks such as business lunches and cars, has come under fire from industry leaders as unfair and overly expensive to comply with.
